DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine well body absorbs carotenoid beta-cryptoxanthin ( BCX ) type corn naturally breed ( genetically engineer ) contain high amount BCX traditional breed corn . Because new type corn contain high amount BCX , appear orange color traditional type corn . Understanding well body absorb BCX corn may help company develop food product may improve nutritional quality .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Beta-cryptoxanthin Bioavailability From Biofortified Maize Humans
DOC.detailed_description: Randomized , blind , 3 x 3 crossover intervention . Each treatment last 12 , follow 7-d wash-out period . After washout , subject go back regular diet two week begin next cycle . Subjects report research kitchen Nutritional Sciences building breakfast . Maize incorporate two muffin . Other food choice yogurt low-fiber food . Blood sample take baseline day 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 , 15 , 19 . Natural abundance measurement 13-carbone 12-carbon take baseline , day 12 day 19 . Retinol isotope dilution test do end study determine total body store vitamin A subject . This include day 19 blood sample intervention phase 3 final blood sample 14 day isotope dose administration .
DOC.criteria: Age 20 28 , BMI 19 26 kg/m2 , nonsmoking , pregnant try become pregnant , lactate . Smoker BMI < 19 kg/m^2 BMI > 26 kg/m^2 Women : pregnant try become pregnant , breastfeed Weight loss great equal 10 pound ( 4.5 kilogram ) 3 month prior recruitment Actively try lose weight Fat malabsorptive disorder Inability refrain drink alcohol request Amenorrhea Acute chronic illness , include hepatitis Current previous history anorexia bulimia History iron deficiency anemia Inability pick food research facility eat meal site request Planned vacation > 1 week duration study Known schedule conflict blood draw Major food allergies/intolerance ingredient use meal Unwillingness discontinue personal nutritional supplements/vitamins ask Concurrent participation study Social circumstance would make difficult consume study food Family member already enrol study
